column1: the German housemaid, the Poison Angel,
Zara Astarita, Elizabeth West, and Jenny Gentile
Born in the town of Fuessen in Bavaria, Germany to Georg and Katharina
Filser.  She was the last of 12 children, 9 of them being boys.  At the time
of Anna Marie’s birth her parents had lost 3 children and 2 of their boys
were killed in action during WWI.
As a young girl she spent 5 months in the hospital due to blood poisoning.
She thought she was going to die several times.
Underwent a goiter operation soon after her sickness. (removal of the
Being the youngest girl, she was her mother’s favorite.
During her teenage years she strayed from her parents and was used to
getting her way.  She was known to sneak out of the house windows late at
Anna never completed high school but will later claim to have along with
Parents shipped her off to her sister, Katti’s house in Holland to help
Anna Marie gives birth to her son, Oscar, out of wedlock. The identity of
She embarrasses her family and the community shuns her; she leaves for
Oscar stays in the care of Anna Marie’s mother in Germany for the first 3
Anna Marie waits 2 years for her visa
Boards the 2nd class cabin on the SS Munchen and arrives in New York.
She stays with her step-uncle, Max, age 74.
22 Anna Marie falls ill with the Scarlet Fever for 3 weeks
Lies about becoming a nurse in Germany and moves in with Charles
Osswald, a retired banker, age 71, to work for him in his home.

column3: He starts to fancy her and she tells him that one day she will marry him.She has no intention to actually follow through with the marriage.She begins to steal his money from him.
Starts to gamble- 1st was a $2.00 bet winning her $260.00 in Latonia, KY.
Gets a job as a chambermaid at 500 room Hotel Alms
Meets future husband, Philip J. Hahn, a telegrapher for Western Union
Married Philip in Buffalo, NY.
Son, Oscar, finally comes to America and the family moves into aconstruction home in Cincinnati.
Received 27 shares of Union Gas and Electric from Osswald which hedenies giving to her along with $700 transfer into her bank account fromhis.
Sells all of the stocks she got from Osswald.
Anna Marie’s uncle makes a new will leaving her everything, stating: “tomy beloved niece, Anna Filser Hahn”.
Sells their family business and buys a bakery/deli.
The Hahn’s rent rooms from Ernest Kohler, a 62 year-old man.She begins to steal prescription pads from the sick man.
Started getting illegal morphine by forging a doctor’s signature on Mr.Kohler’s prescription pads.

Kohler dies under the suspicion he may have been poisoned.   He wasruled to have had throat cancer.  He was cremated and his ashes weregiven to Anna Marie where she placed them on her mantel.Kohler leaves Anna Marie everything in his will.-In her final letter Anna Marie denies any involvement in Kohler’s death.
Sells bakery/deli.Failure to make mortgage payments results in the lost of their home.
Albert Parker, age 72, died soon after she started caring for him.  Sheborrowed money from him and never paid him back.
1st Residence fire on Coleran Ave.  Collects $300 from insurancecompany.
2nd Residence fire
Osswald dies at age 77 and left all his assets to Anna Marie... Theattorney for his will said there were no assets left in the estate.  (AnnaMarie had already taken it all when he was alive).
Philip becomes ill with a stiff leg, drop foot.
Philip’s mother, Maggie, becomes ill after Anna Marie had given her abox of chocolates.
Anna Marie tries to insure her husband’s life for $10,000. It was denied
Anna Marie tries to insure her husband’s life for $5,000.  It was approved
3rd Residence fire.  Collects $2000.00 from insurance for the past 2 fires.
Meets George Heis when buying coal.  They become friends and he beginsto call her “his girl”.
Meets Stina Cable in the ladies room and they go get a beer together.  Shesteals $800.00 from her.  Cable is poisoned and sick for a year.
Anna Marie purchases Croton Oil
Heis falls ill after his feedings from Anna Marie.  He suspects he is beingpoisoned and kicks her out. He becomes paralyzed.
Albert Parker (WM, 72) dies of arsenic poisoning.
Jacob Wagner (WM, 78) dies. Autopsy showed 4 times lethal amount ofarsenic in his body.  Anna Marie poisoned his orange juice and made up afake will in his name.
Loses life insurance when she misses payments.
George Gsellman (WM, 67) dies from metallic poison: Croton Oil

George Obendoerfer dies of Arsenic Poisoning on train to Colorado.Anna Marie steals jewelry and money from the hotel she was staying atwith George.  Pawn shop owners later describe her and a young boy tryingto sell the jewelry.
Arrested for the murder of Jacob Wagner.
Trial begins
Prosecution rested its case. Heis had testifies and the organs of Palmer andWagner were presented as evidence.
Defense began its presentation. Hahn testified as being innocent.
Defense rested
Sentenced to death/electric chair
Transferred to Ohio State Penitentiary
Originally the set date of execution. Continuing appeals pushed theexecution to a later date.
Ohio governor made formal statement refusing to interfere with the court’sdecision.
Anna Marie dies at 8:13 p.m.She is the first woman to die in the electric chair in the state of Ohio.
Laid to rest in unsanctified ground at the Holy Cross Catholic cemetery inColumbus, Ohio.

Mother and Father: Georg and Katharina Filser
Bike and ice skating accidents led to unconsciousness
Craftsman- a cabin maker and furniture manufacturer
At age 18, gives birth to her son, Oscar in 1925.
No record of an IQ test
